Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2012 07:58AM kelleysgroi wrote: I started chemo on November 9 and went back to work on January 16.  I teach dental hygiene and I went back for 4 hours a day 3 days a week. I found it to be exhausting the first week as I had been out for 3 months.  I finish chemo next week and I think working has helped pass some of the time which is the only reason I went back.  Some days it is difficult to get out of bed..chemo sucks!
Posts.Title: working during chemo? vanlex thefuzzylemon

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2011 06:44PM kelleysgroi wrote: I made the decision to have a bilateral mastectomy without giving it a second thought. I do not want to go through this again!  It has been 7 weeks since my surgery and although it has not been a bed of roses i do not regret my decision to have the surgery. i have spoken to  women who have chosen lumpectomy and have been perfectly content with that choice and some women who regret not chosing mastectomy.  You will need to dig down deep to find the best choice for yourself..no matter what you choose..my thoughts and prayers are with you. Kelley

Posts.Content: kelleysgroi wrote: I just finished chemo this past wednesday and was informed then that I would need 6 weeks of radiation.  My PS apparently wants to do the exchange surgery prior to radiation so it will be near the end of March before I get started. Did anyone else wait a month or so? I feel a little nervous about waiting but it is the way things have played out.
